lexUnit.definition: COD: not openly acknowledged or displayed.

sentence.text: North had charge of several covert operations , many of which are still secret ; his brief included counter-terrorism , as well as the sending of arms to Iran and the resupply of the contras .
He also caught a number of covert glances at himself : was that what a few moment 's conversation with a presidential aide did for you in this town ?

The raid represented a convergence of the policing trends referred to in this chapter : the use of covert surveillance , including low-level intelligence ; hard , paramilitary tactics and the enabling legislation to enforce them .
In some great covert laboratory orbiting the outermost ball of frozen rock in some uncharted system ?
Wickham had remarked that covert freelance writing for another publication did not justify making a misleading statement during a murder inquiry .
FROM their very beginnings therefore , and increasingly as they went on , the Iran and contra policies departed even from the strange norms of covert operations .
` Okay but did you ever reread Hamlet as power politics destabilisation covert operations ? "
The covert reasons why the scheme drew widespread support from Cardiff solicitors was that it was part of an internal power struggle .
There are covert branches of the Chinese Communist Party and the Kuomintang in Hong Kong .

The 1979 revolution ended all nuclear efforts until 1984 , when Iran revived the nuclear power program and reportedly began covert procurement for a nuclear weapon program .
Taiwan does not possess nuclear weapons , but began a covert nuclear weapons program in 1964 that ended in 1988 as a result of U.S. pressure .
South Africa 's chemical warfare program was one of the two principal components of its covert state - sponsored CBW program , codenamed Project Coast ( later Project Jota ) .
South Africa 's biological weapons program was one of the two principal components of its covert state - sponsored CBW program , codenamed Project Coast ( later Project Jota ) .
